Posts.Content: Awesome! Loved it!
Posts.Title: Survivors Bust a Move!!!

Posts.Content: Hello, Triple negative breast cancer is usually treat with chemo before surgery and and chemo and radiation after surgery, I have a good friend with late stage triple negative, they are trying everything possible but it has invaded her lungs now. http://www.breastcancer.org/symptoms/diagnosis/trip_neg/trea Here is an article you can read with more info   Gayle
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: Hi Marty, Yes you will have tightness and it will get better as time goes on. They won't be in there that long, soon you will have them filled and the "the bricks" removed and your new implants in and you will forget you ever had them. ask for Xanex or something to help you relax, buy Vit E cream and rub them with that. You will make it and be thrilled with the end results.                              Gayle
Posts.Title: Bilateral Post Mastectomy with Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hello, Triple negative breast cancer is usually treat with chemo before surgery and and chemo and radiation after surgery, I have a good friend with late stage triple negative, they are trying everything possible but it has invaded her lungs now. http://www.breastcancer.org/symptoms/diagnosis/trip_neg/trea Here is an article you can read with more info   Gayle
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: Irish, Take it from a nurgse, could be an infection, call your onc and let them know.....Gayle
Posts.Title: joint pain/swelling

Posts.Content: That's good to know as it didn't seem to have been out that long!
Posts.Title: Generic for arimidex

Posts.Content: Hello Sabine, I am a nurse and a 5yr survivor, I had a stage one estrogen + DCIS.  I also have Multiple Myeloma. I had a stem cell transplant 9/11/09. My experience with cancer is basically the same, you take it one day at a time. My breast cancer was what I called "Baby Cancer." It was small and I chose to have a mastectomy, I did not need chemo or radiation because I chose the mastectomy. The best thing you can do is read all you can and ask questions. This sight means the world to me. You and your son will both be survivors, my best of luck to you Gayle
Posts.Title: Just got diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Sabine, You will know so much more after your surgery, fight the beast and trust your team to make a treatment plan that will make you a long time survivor. My thoughts are with you..                                        Gayle
Posts.Title: Just got diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi yorkydee, Did you have chemo after or before your surgery for breast cancer? What you are complaining about sounds more like neuropathy and the joint pain you get from femara or aromasin.  I lasted 4yrs on femara and it was tough but I just had hot flashes and joint pain.  From chemo I got severe neuropathy for which I take Lyrica and Fentanyl patches. I can not feel my feet or lower legs.. They are basically dead, funny colored feet.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Bahamasgirl, Sorry I forgot to tell you that if you can find a support group, you might take your daughter after the shock has worn off to see there are a lot of survivors and let her know you want to plan to do the Susan Komen walk and let her know that this is a burp in your life, not a death sentance. It will not be easy but I know you can do it.... You might wait until you are dealing with it better, a few days will make a difference.  Prayers for u tonight... Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Hi Lori, I also quit Femara, I did make it 4yrs but the bone pain and hot flashes were too much. I go back to my onc on Tuesday and I have been off of it a year,, I know he is going to be furious but oh well.  We just had a huge discussion about all of these drugs at support group.  So many of us have either quit or just didn't start them in the beginning.  Gayle
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, Did you use saline or silicone? Saline tends to cause ripples. i think in the grand scheme of things you might wait awhile for them to settle.  It takes about 6mos to a year for them to look normal. Take care...Gayle
Posts.Title: appearance of reconstructed breasts

Posts.Content: I told my kids the day I found out and if I had it to do all over again i think I would have waited till I had all the info, but if she lives close you could let her go with you esp to the onc. She may have a lot of questions to be answered.  A lot of which will not be answered until after your surgery. Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Hello Bahamasgirl, Yes you are stressed I am sure, you will need to find out how big the lesion is and possibly have an MRI depending on what part of the breast the cancer is in. I had the exact same diagnosis 7yrs ago and I chose to have a mastectomy as I am a nurse and beyond child bearing years.  I chose reconstruction also and am very happy with the results. I had a double sentinal node and that was removed and it had not spread anywhere. The reconstruction is time consuming afterwards but worth it. I just wish I could have had both breasts removed but I had just had major back surgery and the neurosurgon said I needed at least one arm to get up out of a chair.  So after the surgery you and your doc choose, you will know what stage you are and whether you may need chemo or radiation. Try to calm down, take someone with you to appts and take a notebook to keep track of what the different docs say. You will get through this.  See if you can find a support group in your area. It will help to hear others stories and see what kind of treatment is available in your area. Expect friends and family to be very upset, my co-workers would come into my office crying.  They were  more upset than I was.  Take one step at a time and feel free to ask questions anytime.... Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Kelly, There is a movie on "on Demand" called Living Proof about the inventor of Herceptin. Is a very good movie and it shows you what they go thru on drug trials to get drugs approved.. Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Bahamasgirl, Good Luck and it will be over before you know it and will just be another "blip" in your life! Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Bahamasgirl, Good Luck and it will be over before you know it and will just be another "blip" in your life! Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Bahamasgirl, Sorry I forgot to tell you that if you can find a support group, you might take your daughter after the shock has worn off to see there are a lot of survivors and let her know you want to plan to do the Susan Komen walk and let her know that this is a burp in your life, not a death sentance. It will not be easy but I know you can do it.... You might wait until you are dealing with it better, a few days will make a difference.  Prayers for u tonight... Gayle
Posts.Title: Diagnosed an hour ago -- IDC

Posts.Content: Hi Connie64, Oh my I have a person in my suport group that has had breast cancer at least 7 times and she gets treated and gets a clean bill of health and she and the hubby head out on a cruise! It just depends where it hits and what it hits..  Good luck to your Mom and I hope it is no where else. Gayle
Posts.Title: 3rd time for my mom

Posts.Content: Would be nice if we could all caravan from state to state as breast cancer survivors and we each drive 100-200 miles and get Deemarie there through each state till we get her to MD Anerson.  I no longer work and I am always looking for something to do that is useful...I also believe that nothing is impossible!
Posts.Title: do anyone knows

Posts.Content: Hi Sara, I was on femara for four years and then when I got off I found out the true reason for my bone pain was Multiple Myeloma. Not surw which came first. I am a year out from femara and nothing has changed. But my pain is most likely from mm. Take care  Gayle
Posts.Title: femara long term effects

Posts.Content: Hi Lovelyheart, It may be nothing but also discharge is also a sign of an adrenal tumor.  Is a very simple surgery to fix and will be easier to fix now than later when the tumor is causing infertility...  I don't think you have cancer, also everyone has one breast larger than the other.... Perfectly normal... Relax, tell your Mom and go see a doc...Gayle
Posts.Title: Seventeen and experiencing nipple discharge?

Posts.Content: I am so sorry for your loss.... I can't believe how fast this took her.. Gayle
Posts.Title: My Mum Has Stage 4 Breast Cancer HELP!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Claudia and I agree,exactly.... I only hope the reason we are not hearing back from her is that she is busy having tests............... Gayle
Posts.Title: I am 20 found lump, nipple is inverting and need advice!

Posts.Content: Get a second opinion and a mammogram, cancer has no  specific age and shame on that doctor......... Let us know what u find out. Inverted nipple is a classic sign of a problem.  You have dense breasts as you are young and you are weak because you are scared which u have a right to be. Whatever it is you will deal with it but until u know the fear can be crippling... Gayle 6yr Breast cancer survivor...
Posts.Title: I am 20 found lump, nipple is inverting and need advice!

Posts.Content: Hi Ron, Did they ask her to come back for a biopsy? I was called after my mammogram by the staff to come in for a biopsy. While at the biopsy the doc performing it told me I had 95% likely that it was cancer. I had DCIS and followed up with an MRI and surgery 6wks later. Because I needed only a lumpectomy and chose for a mastectomy I did not need chemo or radiation, 2 lymph nodes neg and estrogen receptor + I took femara for 4yrs and 5yrs later I am well..Gayle
Posts.Title: Wife is scared!

Posts.Content: The hair regrowth after chemo is called chemo curl and will soon go back to your normal hair. It just takes time.....Gayle
Posts.Title: hair regrowth

Posts.Content: Helhelo, I guess I wonder why you know it is stage 4 before you have even had a biopsy.  In the U.S. we have surgery before you can be staged, you need to know if it is in the lymph nodes and the staging is done by the lab after the surgery. Slow down, take this one day at a time.  The cough does not mean it has spread. I've thought the same thing about patients and it has not been the case.  Try over the counter cough syrup and see if that helps, other things like hot tea with honey in it.. Take care and keep in touch.  Gayle
Posts.Title: My Mum Has Stage 4 Breast Cancer HELP!!

Posts.Content: Please don't delay...... Let them know what u have found and hopefully you will get in pronto.. I pray you have nothing but it does not sound like nothing..... Cancer knows no age......Gayle
Posts.Title: I am 20 found lump, nipple is inverting and need advice!

Posts.Content: Where the possibility of cancer is a concern a mammogram is the best tool, who cares about radiation right now, she needs a diagnosis................. Reinventing the wheel is not the answer... Gayle
Posts.Title: I am 20 found lump, nipple is inverting and need advice!

Posts.Content: Thanks Claudia and I agree,exactly.... I only hope the reason we are not hearing back from her is that she is busy having tests............... Gayle
Posts.Title: I am 20 found lump, nipple is inverting and need advice!

Posts.Content: Hello Smoser, I am a six year survivor and I had also so many bone issues from the Femara.  The hot flashes are treatable with several antidepressants.  Ask your doc as you do not have be miserable! I made it four years and was then diagnosed with multiple myeloma so am not sure if the bone pain was really from mm or femara. It doesn't matter which drug they put you on, the side effects seem to be the same.  Some people have no side effects.  Gayle
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: I had terrible bone pain on Femara and made it 4 yrs and finally quit taking it because I had Multiple Myeloma and needed to decide which was Femara and which was Myeloma. Gayle
Posts.Title: Side Effects on Femora

Posts.Content: Hi Katrina49, Oh boy you are not alone!! I had a stem cell ransplant on Sept 11,2009 and I had terrible chemo brain after and for months. I flew to my daughter's in December and it was very difficult to fly and think...... I could not think of words I wanted to say.  Now almost a year later I have more good days than bad days.  My doc did the best thing, he told my husband not to help me.  I needed to figure out words for myself.  Now it is better and I take a couple of days to figure out some words. My hubby sometimes plays word games with me in the car!!!! OHHHHHHH it is for real!!! Gayle
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain

Posts.Content: Hi Katrina49, Oh boy you are not alone!! I had a stem cell ransplant on Sept 11,2009 and I had terrible chemo brain after and for months. I flew to my daughter's in December and it was very difficult to fly and think...... I could not think of words I wanted to say.  Now almost a year later I have more good days than bad days.  My doc did the best thing, he told my husband not to help me.  I needed to figure out words for myself.  Now it is better and I take a couple of days to figure out some words. My hubby sometimes plays word games with me in the car!!!! OHHHHHHH it is for real!!! Gayle
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzy, Have a friend that this happened to, they explained it that the breast cancer occured from the radiation from the lymphoma and she is now cancer free.. Gayle
Posts.Title: ?Hodgkin's lymphoma survivor and now stage1 breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello, Did you maybe include identifying info such as an e-mail address or phone number etc??? Sometimes that makes them remove it.  Otherwise no clue.  ? Did u get an e-mail explaining anything?  Gayle
Posts.Title: Why was my post removed??

Posts.Content: Hi Grammy, I took Femara and did the same thing, I made it 4yrs and then enough is enough, bone aches and I always felt like I had the flu. The surgeon said it was good that I made it 4yrs. Onc doc not so happy but I now have Multiple Myeloma so I now have so much wrong with me that the stage 1 bc 6yrs ago seems minor in comparison..  Take care.. Gayle
Posts.Title: Aromisin

Posts.Content: Hi Nelie, Please talk to your doc about quitting neurontin and start Lyrica. Neurontin causes pretty significant dementia. My doc said no to neurontin. Then if that alone does not work, start a low dose of Fentanyl and work up until pain is better. Remember it may not take all of the pain away but if it is manageable.  You can get toe socks from sock dreams.com , sometimes just keeping the toes from touching makes the pain better. Some people try Vicks salve at night and put socks over your feet. Try to not walk barefooted.  Some people do better with socks and thongs or sandles. The toe socks will work in thongs or sandles and you will find lots of cute socks in there. Everyone has different things that help their feet.  I have been on Lyrica and Fentanyl for nearly 2yrs. I have good days and bad. Changes in the weather will affect u too..  Take care. Gayle
Posts.Title: peripheral neuropathy cause by taxol

Posts.Content: Hi, Yes several of my friends have this. I have it from Velcade which is chemo for Multiple Myeloma, ask your doc about using cymbalta, works like a charm.  My feet still tingle but no longer hurt... Also Lyrica is another drug used also for periheral neuropathy.. Gayle
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Sounds like adhesions, use vitamen e cream and massage like crazy will take time but will get better! Gayle!!
Posts.Title: Hard breast following radiation

Posts.Content: Hi, Yes several of my friends have this. I have it from Velcade which is chemo for Multiple Myeloma, ask your doc about using cymbalta, works like a charm.  My feet still tingle but no longer hurt... Also Lyrica is another drug used also for periheral neuropathy.. Gayle
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Platopotato, Yes you describe the effects of Femara very well.  I managed to stay on it for 4yrs and finally I was diagnosed with Multiple Myeloma and I could not tell which pain was caused by what. I and several others from our support group quit around the same time. Enough was enough.... I made it four years and was miserable and it was time to quit and feel better again. My breast cancer was only stage one so I was in a very low range of having it return after a mastectomy. The doc tried me on other drugs and all caused bone aching and it was no longer worth it. I am at 7yrs and still doing ok... Sometimes quality of life is very important... :) Gayle
Posts.Title: femera/aching joints and muscles

Posts.Content: They will be able to use it for anything it is prescribed for,which will no longer be breast cancer.  Insurance will pay for Avastin as long as you are taking it for anything but breast cancer.  It would be silly to take it for breast cancer as it has been shown to not work for bc but if you so choose you could pay for it out of your own pocket if you have a doc that would write you a prescription for it, but this would be a waste of money also. Take care Gayle
Posts.Title: AVASTIN is being pulled from the market!!!!

Posts.Content: I did that!! I could not have both removed as I had just had back surgery but I would have if it would have been an option.. My onc had a fit, he was furious that I would remove my give me breast for stage one... He said if I would have agreed to have my nipples radiated I could have kept them but he did notayle give me the option. They did move my remaining nipple and now it looks like I have two! I do have two perky breasts. I am 59 and a six year survivor.! Be prepared to do a lot of massaging as they do form adhesions. Gayle
Posts.Title: Hard breast following radiation

Posts.Content: I did that!! I could not have both removed as I had just had back surgery but I would have if it would have been an option.. My onc had a fit, he was furious that I would remove my give me breast for stage one... He said if I would have agreed to have my nipples radiated I could have kept them but he did notayle give me the option. They did move my remaining nipple and now it looks like I have two! I do have two perky breasts. I am 59 and a six year survivor.! Be prepared to do a lot of massaging as they do form adhesions. Gayle
Posts.Title: Hard breast following radiation

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine, I had one breast removed 5yrs ago and an implant put in the other.  I wanted to have both removed and the doc would not do that as I had just had major back surgery and could not have gotten up just using one arm. So I wish both could have been removed but could not. As far as pain, I went back to work at two weeks.  They took the drain out but otherwise I had no feeling.  I am one rare bird.  After the surgery my nipple sensation came back on the back of my arm(this is very rare) People in support group just love it when there is a new person and I tell them. The worst thing that happened was this intense itching in my armpit, all the scratching in the world would not stop it. I did have reconstruction started at the time of my surgery. I like my new boobs better than the old ones. I am 58 yrs old now.  You see breast cancer saved my life.  They found symptoms of early stage multiple multiple myeloma. I just had the breast cancer a stem cell transplant and I hope it gives me more years of life. I did not need chemo or radiation with the breast cancer. Take care, write any time and I wish you the best! Gayle
Posts.Title: Recovery period after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Nelia, Do whatever it takes to make your feet feel better. What works for you may not work for another person and vice versa. I was on Velcade, which is a bad chemo drug and causes very bad neuropathy. But it got me ready for transplant in a jiffy! Take care. Nice to meet u!
Posts.Title: peripheral neuropathy cause by taxol

Posts.Content: Sounds like adhesions, use vitamen e cream and massage like crazy will take time but will get better! Gayle!!
Posts.Title: Hard breast following radiation
